title: Atiyah–Hirzebruch spectral sequence
summary: In mathematics, the Atiyah–Hirzebruch spectral sequence is a spectral sequence for calculating generalized cohomology, introduced by Michael Atiyah and Friedrich Hirzebruch (1961) in the special case of topological K-theory. For a CW complex X {\displaystyle X} and a generalized cohomology theory E ∙ {\displaystyle E^{\bullet }} , it relates the generalized cohomology groups
